byline.original: By DAVE PHILIPPS and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Jon Hurdle contributed reporting from Philadelphia, and Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Federal officials said they found no evidence to confirm that a projectile broke through the window and hit the engineer of the Amtrak train that derailed in Philadelphia last week.

headline.print_headline: Bullet Did Not Strike Windshield of Wrecked Train, Investigators Say
headline.main: Bullet Did Not Strike Windshield of Amtrak Train, Investigators Say

snippet: Federal officials said they found no evidence to confirm that a projectile broke through the window and hit the engineer of the Amtrak train that derailed in Philadelphia last week.
abstract: Federal investigators find no evidence to support theory that engineer of Amtrack train that crashed in Philadelphia was hit by object that broke through train's windshield.
